contextId.information: This is background information to help the reader identify Ahasuerus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: this is Ahasuerus who reigned from India as far as Ethiopia, over 127 provinces

contextId.information: This is background information to explain who these men were. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: the seven officials who served before him

contextId.information: This background information explains why the king called these men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: for this was the king's procedure toward all who were expert in law and judgment

contextId.information: This background information explains how Mordecai came to live in Susa. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylonia carried him and other exiles away along with Jehoiachin, king of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He had been taken away ... king of Babylonia carried away
